basic_information.scholarship_name: Finney Scholars Scholarship for Sociology, Gerontology, & Substance Abuse Studies

description: This scholarship honors Dr. Frank Finney, Jr. In 1971, he became the first dean of the newly-formed College of Liberal Arts. Dr. Finney was passionate about developing the creative potential of students and giving them a sound background in their academic disciplines. "The Finney" recognizes Liberal Arts students who are identified as having a proven record of high academic achievement in their major. Eligibility Requirements Substance Abuse Studies Major Minimum 3.5 GPA Minimum 3.5 overall GPA Full-time undergraduate or graduate student in good standing with the University Shows practical evidence of excellence in the discipline as determined by the department Continuing student for fall semester that the scholarship is awarded
